IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE LOFT'S MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE ARTISTIC DEVELOPMENT OF WRITERS, TO FOSTER A WRITING COMMUNITY, AND TO BUILD AN AUDIENCE FOR LITERATURE.
IRS990.Description: Creative Writing Education: FY10 saw more than 4000 writers and writers in the making participate in over 400 courses, workshops, and labs both at the Loft and at community centers and libraries around the greater Twin Cities area. Student evaluations of our educational programs for the year told us that 90 percent of responding participants believe they gained a greater understanding of the creative writing craft, 84 percent identified their next steps as a writer, and 84 percent said they felt like part of a writing community.

Activity2.Description: Mentorships, Awards, and Events: The Loft's work with Minnesota's emerging writers includes a number of competitive awards and grants including support for projects to advance writing careers; McKnight Artist Fellowships for Writers; and mentorships to work intensively with nationally respected writers of poetry, fiction, and creative nonfiction. The Loft also presented 66 readings and events, introducing more than 7,000 in-person and 600,000 broadcast audience members to the work of 218 local and national writers and spoken word artists.

Activity3.Description: Writing Community and Writers Services: Over 90 writers from communities that are historically underrepresented-including Native American, Ethiopian, deaf- and hearing-impaired, and English language learners-took part in Loft-sponsored open writing and reading groups. Services to writers via Loft.org reached 86,000 unique visitors with articles and discussions about the writing life and the craft of writng through the online journal, A View from the Loft, and a daily blog-The Loft's Writers' Block. The site also provided archived video of readings, interviews, and spoken word performances and writers' resources.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT INVESTMENTS INTEREST AND DIVIDENDS 49,286 UNREALIZED GAIN ON ENDOWMENT 40,722 REALIZED GAIN ON ENDOWMENT 29,010 FEES (11,197) TOTAL 107,821 PLUS UNREALIZED GAIN (40,722) TOTAL OTHER REVENUE 67,099

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S PROGRAM AND FINANCE DIRECTORS ENSURE ALL GRANTS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS AGREE WITH THE TERMS SET FORTH IN THE ORIGINAL GRANT AGREEMENTS. ALL EXPENDITURES MADE ARE REVIEWED FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO PAYMENT. WHERE APPROPRIATE, NARRATIVE REPORTS FROM GRANTEES ACCOMPANY FINANCIAL REPORTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCESS THE ORGANIZATION USES TO REVIEW THE 990
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: PART VI: SECTION A: GOVERNING BODY AND MANAGEMENT: 10
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE PRIOR FISCAL YEAR'S IRS FORM 990 PRIOR TO ITS SUBMISSION TO THE IRS. A THOROUGH PRESENTATION WILL BE MADE BY THE FINANCE DIRECTOR AND/OR THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR/ACCOUNTANT, WHO WILL HAVE WORKED TOGETHER TO PREPARE THE FORM. BECAUSE OF HOLIDAY SCHEDULING IN MOST YEARS THIS WILL OCCUR AT THE JANUARY MEETING, AND WILL REQUIRE A 2 WEEK DELAY IN THE FILING OF THE FORM 990, ACCOMPLISHED BY THE PRO-FORMA FILING OF AN EXTENSION WITH THE IRS. THE FORM 990 IS DUE ON JANUARY 15TH.

EACH YEAR, TYPICALLY AT THE FIRST MEETING OF THE FISCAL YEAR AS A 'STANDING AGENDA ITEM,' ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY FOR THE PURPOSE OF STATING AND/OR UPDATING THEIR DISCLOSURES, AND TO SIGN AND DATE THE FORM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: PROCEDURE TO MAKE DECISIONS REGARDING EXECUTIVE AND STAFF COMPENSATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: RELYING IN SUBSTANTIAL PART ON THE BI-ANNUAL SURVEY OF NON-PROFIT SALARIES CONDUCTED AND PUBLISHED BY THE MINNESOTA COUNCIL OF NON-PROFITS, THE BOARD OF DIRECTOR'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, FOLLOWING A THOROUGH WRITTEN PERFORMANCE REVIEW, ESTABLISHES THE SALARY FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, WITHIN THE LIMITS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN APPROVING THE ORGANIZATION'S BUDGET. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IN TURN, USES THE SAME PROCEDURE FOR ESTABLISHING SALARIES FOR ALL OTHER STAFF, INCLUDING THE FINANCE DIRECTOR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON ITS WEBSITE.

The Loft's mission is to support the artistic development of writers, to foster a writing community, and to build an audience for literature. The Loft's constituencies range from children and adults exploring writing for the first time to some the the nation's most accomplished writiers. The Loft supports anyone who seeks to express ideas creatively through words and the readers who benefit. The Loft's support takes the form of classes for writers of all levels; readings and events featuring national and local literary artists; facilitated writers groups; writing activities for youth ages 6-18; and fellowships, mentorships and career initiative awards for accomplished writers.
